channel.title: odds and ends on chrislaing.net
channel.description: Recent content in odds and ends on chrislaing.net

item.title: Odds and Ends #2
item.description: Naftali Tishby on the Information Theory of Deep Learning. I’m very enthusiastic about this kind of work, and have resolved to find and read more of it. a16z’s AI Playbook may be a couple of years old now, but it’s still an important read. Traces is a Python library for unevenly-spaced time series analysis. I haven’t had a problem to really try this out on, but the website looks slick üëåüèª.

item.title: Odds and Ends #1
item.description: Spektral is a framework for relational representation learning, built in Python and based on the Keras API. The field of Geometric Deep Learning is starting to get some traction. In particular, doing Deep Learning on graphs presents some interesting possibilities. RPC Frameworks: gRPC vs Thrift vs RPyC for python. The state of Python Packaging. Packing in Python is both improving dramatically and harder than it should be.
